instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B -  <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is burning..
threads.message:
No light indication on magsafe, no fan spin, measurements getting crazy up and down on all, I replaced the ILS <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> twice and not much changed, I did noticed that <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> gets realy hot and when adding ipa to it i can see that its pulsing, I changed it to with no changes.
since i cant relay on the measurements I have no clue what causes this issue, but what can make <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> heat up so much?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B -  <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is burning..
threads.message: Check for a short on PPBUS first. If that is ok, replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> and the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B -  <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is burning..
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7690"]Check for a short on PPBUS first. If that is ok, replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> and the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.[/QUOTE]

ok so i replaced the <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> and bingo got green light and fan spinning though the system can't se the  battery no orange light and i get error on ASD sensor voltage VPOR or VP0R PBus sensor is reading below the low limit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B -  <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is burning..
threads.message:
What is your PPBUS voltage 12.3 or 12.56? 
Check around <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> for corrosion, they are the voltage sensors.
